review_text: Every year on vacation, we like to stay in at least one unique accommodation- this is certainly one of them! This grain bin is adorable, down to the "overalls" curtains! Care was certainly taken in designing this unique Airbnb! I loved looking at all of the decor. I was able to see a nice sunset right behind the bin and a beautiful sunrise over the other side of the highway. There are things to do within 10 to 15 minutes. We ate at Ye Olde Trail Tavern, which has interesting decor for us "first-timers"- try the Fritos Chili Pie (which isn't a pie, but still good). The place is right off the highway, which is convenient. (For very light sleepers, this may be out of your comfort zone, but the a/c on the first floor provides white noise, and you can use the fan in the loft to block noise while sleeping, as well.) Note that the staircase to the loft in Bin #1 is spiral, in case of fear or inability; we were fine. Thank you, Brandy, for a fun and unique experience!

What a fun overnight adventure! We love staying in quirky and unusual places! Sometimes that comes with some discomfort, but not this time. Our bin was cozy and comfy and most of all spotless!! What a great job Brandy and her family did, building and decorating this unique space. So many creative touches from “overall curtains” to the 7Up and Royal Crown sink and table! I love the happy feel to this bin! But also appreciate the solid, careful craftsmanship. You want to feel safe on those stairs to the loft, after all!
Tips
If you stay, make sure to catch sunset! At least in April, we could look towards the front of the 2 bins and see the sun sink between!
Don’t miss the 2 barns up the road, with Meramec ads on the roofs! Good photo op!
Also, if you stay on a Monday there are fewer dining options. We had fun with a picnic dinner in the bin! A little too cool that night for grilling, but that would be great another time.
Enjoyed our stay!!

Wow, wow & wow.!!! The Villa is just simply amazing with beautifully appointed decor and well thought out lighting wherever you might need it. The pics are good, but reality is even better. Jo and her son William are wonderful and gracious hosts. The home is perfect for two couples, as nobody gets a bedroom that is lesser than the other. Both rooms have the most awesome sunrise views. We did not use the 3rd bedroom, but it would have been perfect for a couple of grand kids if they could have joined us. This visit was for myself, my guy, along with my son and his wife.
For an additional cleaning fee, we coordinated with Jo and William to take advantage of the using the kayaks to float the Osage Arm of the Gasconade River. We started with a 9:30 pick-up at the The Villa, by the time we floated to the first put-out access, it was after 3pm. Because we had pretty much decided to only do the shorter 4.8 mile float versus the longer 13+ mile float; we wanted it to last and did not paddle much. The river was down and running slow. We did have to do a few portages over the shallow river bottom. My son and his wife did a tandem kayak and would recommend the single kayaks if the river is low, as it was on our weekend. The tandem is heavier and required a few more portages than the singles did. The views, the trees, the peacefulness along the Osage Arm were so nice. No litter and no craziness of some of our busier float rivers in Missouri.
Jo recommended we use the Pro Angler App to determine the river conditions. I will do that for the next trip. On this trip I was the organizer and was so busy planning meals and timing that I didn’t prioritize using the app and I think it would’ve been helpful. I am already planning to return again to float and maybe try the Niangua River. Yes, the Niangua has the reputation of being crowded, but If the Osage Arm is lower than what we had the weekend of August 28, I figure a good back-up would be HVO (Hidden Valley Outfitters) at 27101 Marigold Dr, Lebanon, MO; 36 minutes and 27 miles from The Villa. Of course you will have to book with Hidden Valley and get yourself over there and back, but it is a back up or alternative and I don’t think that is a big deal in order to have the quality accommodations that are part of being at The Villa. You could do the cabins that the outfitters like HVO offer, but The Villa isn’t even on the same level. The Villa is refined living with peaceful sunrises, sunsets, great outdoor spaces and most importantly privacy and gracious hosts that are the salt of the earth.
I was very blessed in that I found The Villa available without making plans months in advance, as places like Jo’s are usually booked all summer long. Because she had just listed it on Airbnb, I was able to book and be her 3rd set of guests. The hardest part of booking was ensuring I understood all the details of getting the kayaks set up for the Osage Arm. I wanted to make sure I didn’t lock myself in without recourse or refund and not understand some logistics detail or not be able to float. I assure you that once you book with Jo and you talk to her right away to iron out any details you will be be pleased; if not and it is within a few hours of the booking, I’m sure she would release you. Jo didn’t tell me this, but just talking to her I feel her accommodating spirit if everything is done correctly and in a timely manner.
Very important: I realize that Jo has a lot of information on house rules and expectations, but because she has taken time to write everything out there is no misunderstanding. I appreciated this and I know it will serve to keep The Villa in tiptop shape for years to come. Do I take my shoes off in my own home? No. But I did it at The Villa and I appreciated the uber clean floors. Before leaving KC we checked the dogs in at at Cuddle Up Pup in Blues Springs, MO. The most stress free dog boarding kennel our dogs have ever experienced….it was like a spa weekend for them and they smelled good and had their nail trimmed when we picked them up. We did have a smoker in our group. He knew the rules. He didn’t complain and I have no idea how he managed, but he did and I think all went very well. The Villa is an amazing property that most anyone will be grateful that they booked with no regrets.
One last thing, as I was leaving Lebanon on Sunday I picked up a booklet that is produced by the City of Lebanon’s Office of Tourism & Marketing. They are on FB/ VisitLebanonMO or you could call them and have them send you the Getaway Guide, plus you could ask and plan ahead of time if there are any local entertainment bookings. Our family really liked Lebanon. We had Sunday morning coffee and breakfast at Judes before departing.
Knuckles and High Fives to Jo and William! Hope to do it all again sometime soon.

Renters beware - if you have a maintenance issue with this renter and they do not resolve the situation for you, you are just out of luck - A/C was not working properly. When we arrived, the internal temperature in the house was 80 degrees. Contacted the property manager within an hour of arriving, but had to leave for a wedding. Stephanie was quick to respond and had a technician at the house while we were at the wedding. Rec'd a message that the unit was frozen, but should be fine when we got home. Got home around 11 pm and the house was still at 80 degrees. Tried to reach Stephanie again, but didn't get a response until the next morning, after it no longer mattered, as we were only there for 1 night. She simply responded to "open the windows". We tried to do that the night before, but the 2 windows in the front living room would not stay up, and almost fell out when we tried to raise them. The window in the kitchen also would not open. This led to a very uncomfortable and hot night as it was too late to find accommodations elsewhere. When I contacted her in the morning asking for some sort of compensation for the uncomfortable arrangements, she refused, saying it was "out of their control". Response to the original problem was quick, however, the problem was never resolved. Stephanie simply said, "we thought the unit would defrost by the time you returned". After trying to continue to reason with her, she merely stopped responding. Am now in the process of appealing through Air Bnb.
Fire ring in the back yard was not useable - overgrown with huge weeds. Food was left in the freezer from prior renters. Cleaning job was sub par. Kitchen chairs need replacing. Will not stay here again! I would consider this more of a cabin then a house. If property manager was more willing to come to some sort of agreement on partial compensation, it would've been ok, but still not somewhere I'd stay again.
